sentences.en: A benighted creature who has the folly to worship something that he can see and feel.
sentences.cn: 异教徒:名词,愚昧无知的人,他崇拜某种看得见摸得着的东西.

sentences.en: Famine hit that benighted country once more.
sentences.cn: 饥荒再次袭击了那个落后的国家。

sentences.en: If you don't hurry, we might be benighted on the way.
sentences.cn: 如果你不快点, 我们在入夜前可能无法抵达.

sentences.en: In the benighted Middle Ages, intellectual curiosity was discouraged by the authorities.
sentences.cn: 在中世纪这个黑暗的年代里, 求知欲全给统治阶级扼杀了.

sentences.en: Listen to both sides and you will be enlightened , heed only one side and you will be benighted.
The benighted Chechens were not the only victims of the amorality.
sentences.cn: 愚昧无知的车臣人并非是唯一的是非不分的牺牲者.

sentences.en: The benighted peoples of this area.
sentences.cn: 封建道德使这儿的人们愚昧.

trans.tran_cn: （旅客等）赶路到黑的，无知的，蒙昧的，愚昧无知，怐婺
